c74object.name: seq.notes~

method.name: in2
method.description: A list of floats between 0 and 1 to the second inlet stores a sequence. If any value of the list is either less than 0 or greater than one, the entire list will be normalized to the range of 0. 1. before being stored.

method.name: sequence
method.description: The same as in2, prepended by the symbols "message sequence"

attribute.name: octave
attribute.digest: Octave for which to produce MIDI note values

attribute.name: sustain
attribute.digest: When enabled, the default, the object will hold its current value when its input receives a value of 0 (or lower). When disabled, it will output 0. when its input is 0. or lower.

attribute.name: length
attribute.digest: Number of notes in the scale.

attribute.name: octaverange
attribute.digest: Sets the number of steps to map to the input valuesâ€™ normalized range. The number of steps is length times octaverange.

attribute.name: microtones
attribute.digest: Subdivides the semitone into increments to allow scales to be used microtonally. With a value of 1 (the default), the object outputs whole-number MIDI notes.

c74object.description: seq.notes is a sibling of seq.sequence that is designed to be used specifically for playing back musical pitches as MIDI notes. Use this object in conjunction with seq.scala~ to play melodies in any scale.
c74object.digest: Store and playback a sequence of notes.
